Class DataSaveController

java.lang.Object
controller.BaseController
controller.DataSaveController
public class DataSaveController extends BaseController
Controller for managing data persistence operations across all system repositories.

This controller handles the business logic for:

  • Saving all system data to CSV files
  • Loading all system data from CSV files
  • Managing the data directory structure
  • Coordinating persistence across multiple repositories
  • Error handling and reporting for data operations

Data Persistence Strategy:

  • Format: CSV (Comma-Separated Values) for human readability
  • Directory: Configurable base directory (default: src/data)
  • Atomicity: All-or-nothing approach - reports all errors at once
  • Dependencies: Handles entity relationships during load operations

File Structure: 

 src/data/
 ├── students.csv          - Student accounts and profiles
 ├── companyreps.csv       - Company representative accounts
 ├── staffs.csv            - Career center staff accounts
 ├── internships.csv       - Internship postings
 ├── applications.csv      - Student applications (depends on students and internships)
 └── withdrawals.csv       - Withdrawal requests (depends on applications)
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • DataSaveController

      public DataSaveController(StudentRepository students, CompanyRepRepository reps, CareerCenterStaffRepository staff, InternshipRepository internships, ApplicationRepository applications, WithdrawalRequestRepository withdrawals)
      Constructs a DataSaveController with the default base directory "src/data".

      This constructor is typically used in production where the standard data directory structure is desired.

      Parameters:
      students - the repository for managing student data
      reps - the repository for managing company representative data
      staff - the repository for managing career center staff data
      internships - the repository for managing internship posting data
      applications - the repository for managing application data
      withdrawals - the repository for managing withdrawal request data

    • DataSaveController

      public DataSaveController(StudentRepository students, CompanyRepRepository reps, CareerCenterStaffRepository staff, InternshipRepository internships, ApplicationRepository applications, WithdrawalRequestRepository withdrawals, Path baseDir)
      Constructs a DataSaveController with a custom base directory.

      This constructor allows specifying a custom data directory, useful for:

      • Testing with temporary directories
      • Using alternative storage locations
      • Supporting multiple data environments

      The constructor automatically creates the base directory if it doesn't exist.

      Parameters:
      students - the repository for managing student data
      reps - the repository for managing company representative data
      staff - the repository for managing career center staff data
      internships - the repository for managing internship posting data
      applications - the repository for managing application data
      withdrawals - the repository for managing withdrawal request data
      baseDir - the base directory for storing CSV files (defaults to "src/data" if null)

  • Method Details

    • saveAll

      public void saveAll(String studentsCsv, String repsCsv, String staffCsv, String internshipsCsv, String applicationsCsv, String withdrawalsCsv) throws IOException
      Saves all system data to CSV files in the base directory.

      Workflow:

      1. Attempts to save each repository to its respective CSV file
      2. Continues attempting all saves even if some fail
      3. Collects all error messages encountered
      4. If any errors occurred, throws IOException with all error details

      Files Created:

      • studentsCsv - Student account data
      • repsCsv - Company representative data
      • staffCsv - Career center staff data
      • internshipsCsv - Internship posting data
      • applicationsCsv - Student application data
      • withdrawalsCsv - Withdrawal request data

      Error Handling: The method uses a "continue on error" approach, attempting to save all repositories even if some fail. This ensures maximum data preservation in case of partial failures.

      Parameters:
      studentsCsv - the filename for student data (e.g., "students.csv")
      repsCsv - the filename for company representative data
      staffCsv - the filename for staff data
      internshipsCsv - the filename for internship data
      applicationsCsv - the filename for application data
      withdrawalsCsv - the filename for withdrawal request data
      Throws:
      IOException - if any save operation fails, with details of all failures

    • loadAll

      public void loadAll(String studentsCsv, String repsCsv, String staffCsv, String internshipsCsv, String applicationsCsv, String withdrawalsCsv) throws IOException
      Loads all system data from CSV files in the base directory.

      Workflow:

      1. Checks if each CSV file exists before attempting to load
      2. Loads repositories in dependency order:
        • Students (no dependencies)
        • Company representatives (no dependencies)
        • Staff (no dependencies)
        • Internships (no dependencies)
        • Applications (depends on students and internships)
        • Withdrawals (depends on applications, students, and staff)
      3. Continues attempting all loads even if some fail
      4. Collects all error messages encountered
      5. If any errors occurred, throws IOException with all error details

      Missing Files: If a file doesn't exist, the system logs a message but doesn't treat it as an error. This allows for partial system initialization with only available data.

      Dependency Management: Some repositories require references to other repositories during loading (e.g., applications need to link to students and internships). The load order ensures these dependencies are available.

      Parameters:
      studentsCsv - the filename for student data (e.g., "students.csv")
      repsCsv - the filename for company representative data
      staffCsv - the filename for staff data
      internshipsCsv - the filename for internship data
      applicationsCsv - the filename for application data
      withdrawalsCsv - the filename for withdrawal request data
      Throws:
      IOException - if any load operation fails, with details of all failures

    • getBaseDir

      public Path getBaseDir()
      Returns the base directory path where CSV files are stored.

      Useful for:

      • Verifying the data directory location
      • Building full paths to specific files
      • Debugging data persistence issues
      Returns:
      the base directory path

    • isInitialized

      public boolean isInitialized()
      Checks if all required repositories have been initialized.

      Verifies that all six repositories (students, company reps, staff, internships, applications, and withdrawals) are not null. This is important before attempting any data operations.

      Use Cases:

      • Pre-flight checks before save/load operations
      • System initialization validation
      • Debugging configuration issues
      Returns:
      true if all repositories are initialized (not null), false otherwise
